channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-2730] Expose RS work queue contents on web UI
item.description: Would be nice to be able to see the contents of the various work queues - eg to know what regions are pending compaction/split/flush/etc. This is handy for debugging why a region might be blocked, etc.
item.summary: Expose RS work queue contents on web UI

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Enable QueueDump in the web UI for each region server. By default, "hbase.regionserver.servlet.show.queuedump" equals false to disable this feature. Otherwise, there will be a new link (called "Queue Dump") on rs-status page. It will dump the content of those compaction(both small and large)/split/flush queues.

Can you attach screen shot of queue dump ?

Thanks

By default, "hbase.regionserver.servlet.show.queuedump" equals false to disable this feature

Why not add this to the debug dump? Why do we need a separate dump/report? Why should it be disabled by default?
The sample output file for queue dump

Why not add this to the debug dump? Why do we need a separate dump/report? Why should it be disabled by default?

1. Yes. we can put it into debug dump. However the current debug dump is a little bit long, it is quite convenient and clear to view the queue dump in a new page in our test environment. That is why we create a separate report here.
2. Good point. Actually, we make it enabled by default in our test environment. We can turn on this dump by default if it is acceptable.

Thank you for your time and comment.
Still think it should go into the debug dump.

Thanks for the comments. Two modifications:
1. Enable the queue dump by default. We can also disable it by set "hbase.regionserver.servlet.show.queuedump" as false.
2. Add the queue dump into debug dump
The updated sample output for queue dump.

Good stuff. I agree w/ Andrew that best place to put it at first at least is into the dump output (as you have done in your latest patch). Thanks.

FYI, we make patches homed at just under your hbase checkout rather than at the root of your filesystem. HadoopQA, the patch tester, won't be able to digest your offered patch otherwise.

In future, rather than do:


+    if( hrs.isShowQueueDump() ) {

... and then indent your whole method because of the if clause, I'd do if (!hrs.isShow...()) return;

Then you'd save an indent.

For the future.

Does this have to be public?


+  public boolean isShowQueueDump(){

Maybe it does but it would be sweet if the servlet could read it w/o having to have a public method (can't the servlet just read this value w/o having to go to the regionserver? Isn't the Configuration in the servlet context? The RegionServer already has too much public on it).

Finally, isn't there more you could dump? I'd like to see list of currently opening regions for example (IIRC, the regionserver has a list of regions its currently working on opening).

Good stuff Jie.

Thanks for those detailed comments.

1. Sorry for my carelessness. I have removed the absolute path in the patch file.
2. I have removed that public function isShowQueueDump(). and put the conf object into the servlet context. It also solves the indent problem as well.
3. One more thing we can include is the list of regionsInTransitionInRS. what do you think?

To dump those regions which are in the transition of opening or closing. One more thing, in the current implementation, I only list the encodedRegionName instead of the entire regionName. If it is not clear enough, I will try to figure out the way to dump the whole regionName.

Just ignore the previous patch and comments on RS in transition. Since I found that we needn't to dump those regions under opening or closing in the queue-dump. That work is already done in the Master-Status. I wonder if it is OK for the queque-dump patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12535824/hbase-2730.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 javac. The applied patch generated 5 javac compiler warnings (more than the trunk's current 4 warnings).

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 8 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.TestReplication

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2359//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2359//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2359//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2359//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1 on patch. Mind posting sample of what it looks like Jie?
Thanks Stack. You can find the sample output in dump.png file in the attachment. Any comment, please let me know. thanks for your time.
Does the 29th of June output include output from the patch uploaded July 10th?
The latest patch against trunk comes from that patch_0.94.0_v2, so the output are the same.
Committed to 0.94 (operability) and to trunk. Thanks for the patch Jie.
